_comment: Self-Streme Egg, v9 - Fix EROFS (logs directory creation)
name: Self-Streme
author: zvielkoren@github.com
description: A powerful self-hosted streaming server with Stremio integration. This egg efficiently copies files from the pre-built Docker image during installation, and ensures writable directories are created.

installation.script:
#!/bin/bash

cd /mnt/server

# Check if the directory is empty (no package.json). If so, copy files from Docker image.
if [ ! -f package.json ]; then
    echo "Server directory empty. Copying application files from Docker image's /app directory..."
    cp -r /app/. /mnt/server/
    echo "Files copied from Docker image to /mnt/server."
else
    echo "Server directory already contains files. Skipping copy from Docker image."
fi

# Ensure media, temp, and logs directories exist
mkdir -p media temp logs

# Create the run.sh script
cat > run.sh << 'EOF'
#!/bin/bash
if [ ! -f .env ]; then
    echo "PORT=${SERVER_PORT:-7000}" > .env
    echo "TORRENT_PORT=${TORRENT_PORT:-6881}" >> .env
    # Add other environment variables as needed here if they are not directly passed to the Docker image
fi
node src/index.js
EOF
chmod +x run.sh

echo "Installation complete! Server is ready to start."

variables.name: Torrent Port
variables.description: Port for incoming P2P connections (TCP/UDP). Must be allocated as an additional port in the panel.

variables.name: Base URL
variables.description: The public URL for accessing Self-Streme (e.g., https://your-domain.com). Leave empty for auto-detection.

variables.name: Cloudflare Tunnel Token
variables.description: Optional Cloudflare Tunnel token for exposing the server.
